content: You have entered a circular map. In the following questions, I will tell you what items are on the map, as well as your position and movements. You need to tell me the item you find after your movements. Please provide only the name of the item. Note that your answer should include only the name of the item and no other words.

You have been given a circular path consisting of 20 connected dots. At the start, you are positioned on the dot that is located at the top of the path, where you find a frying pan. Moving in a clockwise direction from the frying pan, the elements on the path are an espresso, a plow, a safety pin, a projectile, a spoonbill, a water tower, a lemon, a guinea pig, a Boston Terrier, an African rock python, a balance beam, a cheeseburger, an axolotl, a chain-link fence, a jaguar, a tailed frog, a jacamar, a Malinois, and a sarong. Starting from the African rock python, you move around the ring by 18 steps in a clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 1 step in a clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 2 steps in a counter-clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 1 step in a counter-clockwise direction. What will you find?

After moving around the ring by 18 steps in a clockwise direction, you will reach the sarong. Then you move around the ring by 1 step in a counter-clockwise direction and 2 steps in a clockwise direction, which takes you to the axolotl. Finally, you move around the ring by 1 more step in a counter-clockwise direction, which takes you to the Malinois. Therefore, you will find the Malinois after your movements.

Starting from the African rock python, you move around the ring by 1 step in a clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 1 step in a counter-clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 18 steps in a clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 1 step in a clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 2 steps in a counter-clockwise direction, and you move around the ring by 1 step in a counter-clockwise direction. What will you find?

After moving around the ring by 1 step in a clockwise direction from the African rock python, you will reach the Malinois. Then you move around the ring by 1 step in a counter-clockwise direction, which takes you to the jacamar. After that, you move around the ring by 18 steps in a clockwise direction, which brings you to the end of the path. At this point, there are no more elements on the path. Therefore, you will reach the end of the path and will not find any further items.
